description.raw:
When a test fails to run in jenkins, it doesn't have the name of the test displayed in the test results page:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/254/testReport/

This updates the check_test_ran.py script to use the test file name in the junit classname, so that jenkins can differentiate between tests that failed to run and you don't have to look at the console output.

It also adds a fix to output a new junit file if a junit file exists but is empty. I copied these changes from gazebo.

This updates the check_test_ran.py script to use the test file name in the junit classname, so that jenkins can differentiate between tests that failed to run and you don't have to look at the console output.

It also adds a fix to output a new junit file if a junit file exists but is empty. I copied these changes from gazebo.
